column1: Westland (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈʋɛstlɑnt] (listen)) is a municipality in the western Netherlands
column2: in the province of South Holland. It covers an area of 90.74 km2 (35.03 sq mi) of which 9.47 km2 (3.66 sq mi) is covered by water and had a population of 108

column1: Towns and other settlements: De Lier
== History ==
Westland was created on 1 January 2004 by a merger of the municipalities De Lier
column4: Naaldwijk and Wateringen. These are also the names of five of the settlements. The others are Heenweg
column9: and Ter Heijde. Westland itself is not the name of a settlement or town
column10: but rather of the region. The City hall is located in the middle of Westland
column12: the second largest settlement in Westland.The town of Honselersdijk also possesses the largest Flower Auction
column14: which also has a location in Rijnsburg. This is a very important sector of the Westland economy. Flowers produced in Westland are sold all over the world.

column1: Coastal towns are Ter Heijde (near Monster)
column2: Monster itself and 's-Gravenzande. These towns are popular with Germans and people from the Eastern Netherlands. It is not unknown for every holiday campsite to be fully booked with tourists because of their relative proximity to the more popular Scheveningen.

column1: == Wider area ==
Westland is part of the Haaglanden conurbation.
In a wider sense
column2: Westland is also the name of the region south-west of the line The Hague - Delft - Rotterdam
column3: approximately consisting of the municipalities Westland and Midden-Delfland
column4: as well as Hoek van Holland (municipality of Rotterdam).

column1: Westland is most known for its horticulture in greenhouses

column1: Anneliese Van Der Pol (born 1984 in Naaldwijk) a Dutch-American actress and singer
